definition: history/annals/title of an official historian in ancient China
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: Yuan Hong, "In the history of transmission of the hing, so pass ancient and modern and Benedict Norm."
sentences.chinese: 袁宏提出，“史传之兴，所以通古今而笃名教”。

sentences.english: As we all know, GuoYu is a masterpiece of biographically historic literature about Pre-Qin period.
sentences.chinese: 《国语》是先秦时期一部史传文学名著。

sentences.english: Its art origin is Historical-literature and Talk-art.
sentences.chinese: 其艺术渊源是史传文学和说话艺术。

sentences.english: The criteria for its literary criticism are respectively based on two perspectives: collection of historical materials and compilation of historical biographies.
sentences.chinese: 其立论标准，分别基于史料采集与史传编著两个视角。

definition: the 24 or 25 official dynastic histories/true history, as opposed to fictional adaptation or popular legends
Records of the Grand Historian, by 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1], first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3]
history genre based on biography, such as Sima Qian's Record of the Historian
Grand Scribe, the title by which Sima Qian 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1] refers to himself in Records of the Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4]
History of the Jin Dynasty, fifth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Fang Xuanling 房玄齡|房玄龄[Fang2 Xuan2 ling2] in 648 during Tang Dynasty 唐朝[Tang2 chao2], 130 scrolls
History of the Former Han Dynasty, second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Ban Gu 班固[Ban1 Gu4] in 82 during Eastern Han (later Han), 100 scrolls
Extensive records of the Taiping era (978), fictional history edited by Li Fang 李昉

History of Eastern Han (later Han), third of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Fan Ye 范曄|范晔[Fan4 Ye4] in 445 during Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋[Nan2 chao2 Song4], 120 scrolls
